article.headline: Lafayette 81, Bucknell 72
article.story: EASTON, Pa. (AP) -- Freshman reserve Marcus Harley scored 14 points to lead Lafayette to an 81-72 victory over Bucknell on Sunday. Lafayette (14-4, 5-0 Patriot League) went 8-for-10 from the foul line down the stretch to seal the win. The Leopards outscored Bucknell (6-12, 2-3) 23-7 from the line. Harley led four Leopards in double figures and 10 players scored for Lafayette, which improved to 10-0 at home this season. Kevin Bettencourt and Chris McNaughton scored 16 points each for Bucknell. McNaughton was 8-for-10 from the floor and pulled down 10 rebounds before fouling out. Rob Dill scored 13 points and Justin DeBerry scored 12 for the Leopards. Charles Lee was also in double figures for Bucknell with 12 points. Mike Farrell scored nine points and pulled down nine rebounds for Lafayette. Late in the first half, Farrell grabbed his 500th career rebound.
